probably works much better.

pullrequest.title: Install from source instructions for default

content.raw:
For handling the dependencies probably the best way would be to sniff it from our own release-repo. Something like:

```
#!bash
wget https://bitbucket.org/osrf/release-tools/raw/default/jenkins-scripts/lib/dependencies_archive.sh -O /tmp/dependencies.sh
ROS_DISTRO=dummy . /tmp/dependencies.sh
sudo apt-get install $(sed 's:\\ ::g' <<< $GAZEBO_BASE_DEPENDENCIES) $(sed 's:\\ ::g' <<< $BASE_DEPENDENCIES)
```
content.html:
For handling the dependencies probably the best way would be to sniff it from our own release-repo. Something like:

wget https://bitbucket.org/osrf/release-tools/raw/default/jenkins-scripts/lib/dependencies_archive.sh -O /tmp/dependencies.sh
ROS_DISTRO=dummy . /tmp/dependencies.sh
sudo apt-get install $(sed 's:\\ ::g' <<< $GAZEBO_BASE_DEPENDENCIES) $(sed 's:\\ ::g' <<< $BASE_DEPENDENCIES)

content.raw: @_jrivero_ , thanks for all the feedback. I made this into a tutorial to install default rather than gazebo7 because 7 doesn't exist yet. The idea of the tutorial is to give contributors up-to-date information on how to install the default branch.
content.html: @jrivero , thanks for all the feedback. I made this into a tutorial to install default rather than gazebo7 because 7 doesn't exist yet. The idea of the tutorial is to give contributors up-to-date information on how to install the default branch.

pullrequest.title: Install from source instructions for default

content.raw:
I'm not sure what the best procedure would be here. I think tutorial pages always open on the latest version by default.

1. Do we want a tutorial for `default` instead of `gazebo7`? If so, how would it show on the top-right dropdown? `default`? `dev`? Would it be the last one on the list? (Apparently versions containing characters other than numbers are broken see [this](http://gazebosim.org/tutorials?tut=install_from_source&cat=install&branch=source_install_gz7&ver=default)  - issue #32)

1. Do we want this tutorial to be the one open by default when users look for install-from-source instructions, or do we want directions to a stable version?

1. As for stable versions, do we need a tutorial for `gazebo5` and another for `gazebo6`, both currently missing?

1. Do we want a tutorial for `gazebo7` even before it is released?

@nkoenig
content.html:
I'm not sure what the best procedure would be here. I think tutorial pages always open on the latest version by default.

  1. Do we want a tutorial for default instead of gazebo7? If so, how would it show on the top-right dropdown? default? dev? Would it be the last one on the list? (Apparently versions containing characters other than numbers are broken see this - issue #32)

  2. Do we want this tutorial to be the one open by default when users look for install-from-source instructions, or do we want directions to a stable version?

  3. As for stable versions, do we need a tutorial for gazebo5 and another for gazebo6, both currently missing?

  4. Do we want a tutorial for gazebo7 even before it is released?

@nkoenig

pullrequest.title: Install from source instructions for default

content.raw:
1. I think that it the most useful thing to keep is one for default. 
2. my vote for default
3. We can make versioned tutorials when we release a new gazebo version by copying the default tutorial. But I won't do previous versions if they are not requested by any user. gazebo6 is probably the same than this PR.
4. I don't think so, it is covered by default.

My 0.02 cents.
content.html:
1. I think that it the most useful thing to keep is one for default.
  2. my vote for default
  3. We can make versioned tutorials when we release a new gazebo version by copying the default tutorial. But I won't do previous versions if they are not requested by any user. gazebo6 is probably the same than this PR.
  4. I don't think so, it is covered by default.

My 0.02 cents.

content.raw:
I think the following would work:
~~~
diff -r 6fdffa14172e manifest.xml
--- a/manifest.xml	Tue Aug 04 16:01:26 2015 -0700
+++ b/manifest.xml	Tue Aug 11 17:15:06 2015 -0700
@@ -63,6 +63,7 @@
 
     <tutorial title="From source (Ubuntu and Mac)" ref='install_from_source'>
       <markdown version="4.0">install_from_source/tutorial_4-0.md</markdown>
+      <markdown version="default">install_from_source/tutorial_default.md</markdown>
       <description>
        Installation instructions for building a gazebo application using the
        source code. For user who want to contribute with code patches or pull
~~~
content.html:
I think the following would work:

diff -r 6fdffa14172e manifest.xml
--- a/manifest.xml  Tue Aug 04 16:01:26 2015 -0700
+++ b/manifest.xml  Tue Aug 11 17:15:06 2015 -0700
@@ -63,6 +63,7 @@

     <tutorial title="From source (Ubuntu and Mac)" ref='install_from_source'>
       <markdown version="4.0">install_from_source/tutorial_4-0.md</markdown>
+      <markdown version="default">install_from_source/tutorial_default.md</markdown>
       <description>
        Installation instructions for building a gazebo application using the
        source code. For user who want to contribute with code patches or pull
